title: How to Make a Toilet Paper Tube Butterfly

steps.headline: Design the wings to measure the same height as the tube.
steps.description: Make them wide enough to appear balanced. Use a very simple design for the wings, making a mirror image for the opposite side.

steps.headline: Draw the design onto the scrap cardboard.
steps.description: Cut around each wing (or both wings if you have designed them already joined). The wings can be jazzed up a little by cutting them out with pinking shears.

steps.headline: Decorate the wings.
Glue or tape to the back of the covered toilet paper tube.
steps.description: Check that they appear even each side.

steps.headline: Glue two cotton buds (Q-tips) at the top end of the butterfly.
steps.description: These form the antennae. They can be colored by either drawing on them with marker or dipping them first in paint water and letting them dry before affixing to the tube. Alternatively, cut pipe cleaners in half and glue in place. Roll down the top of the pipe cleaner in a spiral, to make it seem more realistic.

steps.headline: Draw a face on the butterfly.
steps.description: Draw two eyes and a smile at the top end of the butterfly, near the antennae. Alternatively, cut out pieces of felt or scrap paper in the shapes of eyes and a mouth and glue these on.
